docs.lead_paragraph: Pershing Square Capital Management LP, the hedge fund firm run by William Ackman, has sued the U.S. government, claiming that its stripping of Fannie Mae's and Freddie Mac's profit illegally short changes investors in the mortgage companies' common stock.

docs.lead_paragraph: A senior U.S. senator said on Thursday he has written to Hospira Inc and urged the drug and medical device maker not to move its tax domicile abroad to save on U.S. taxes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large international study questions the conventional wisdom that most people should cut back on salt, suggesting that the amount most folks consume is OK for heart health — and too little may be as bad as too much. The findings came under immediate attack by other scientists.

headline.main: Study Questions Need for Most People to Cut Salt

docs.lead_paragraph: Fund managers are increasingly turning to investigative tactics, detailed accounting analysis and corporate sleuthing in a bid to uncover skeletons in company closets that can offer an investment edge in a low-yield world.

docs.lead_paragraph: The discovery of a small network of brain cells holds the potential to advance to treatment of eating disorders in people.

headline.main: A Mouse Switch Turns Off Appetite
headline.print_headline: A Mouse Switch Turns Off Appetite

docs.abstract: Scientists have discovered small network of cells in mouse brain that turns appetite on and off; discovery may eventually lead to better understanding and treatment of eating disorders in humans.
docs.snippet: The discovery of a small network of brain cells holds the potential to advance to treatment of eating disorders in people.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you use a whole fish, you can use the bones to make a fish stock for poaching. But fillets can also be poached in a lighter broth. They are rubbed with a Middle Eastern spice mix.

docs.snippet: If you use a whole fish, you can use the bones to make a fish stock for poaching. But fillets can also be poached in a lighter broth. They are rubbed with a Middle Eastern spice mix.

docs.lead_paragraph: The increasing application of antimonopoly laws, against companies like Microsoft and Qualcomm, has raised concern in boardrooms around the world.

headline.main: China’s Energetic Enforcement of Antitrust Rules Alarms Foreign Firms
headline.print_headline: China’s Energetic Enforcement of Antitrust Rules Alarms Foreign Firms

docs.abstract: China's increasing application of antimonopoly laws, targeting companies like Microsoft and Qualcomm, is raising concern in boardrooms around the world; foreign companies fear they could become easy targets for officials from array of competing agencies and local governments aiming to impress Pres Xi Jinping.
docs.snippet: The increasing application of antimonopoly laws, against companies like Microsoft and Qualcomm, has raised concern in boardrooms around the world.
